line.en: The last day of the summer holiday.
'Amane.'
'Huh? Hey there, Aoi. Why are you up so early?'
'That's my line. You weren't in the dormitory, so\nI thought you might be here.'
I woke up early, but I didn't see Amane anywhere.\nAll her things in her room were carefully packed\naway.
'Yeah. I thought I'd tidy everything up before\nthe others come back.'
'I'll soon be going to my dad's lab.'
Today is the last day of the summer holiday.
In other words, the day that Amane leaves the\nschool.
'We still have one more day, though.'
'Hmm. But there's nothing left to do, is there?'
Everyone was planning to get up before dawn again\nand go to the runway.
We didn't think that a miraculous phenomenon\nwould occur two days in a row, but even so, we\nwanted to believe there was a slight chance.
However, I knew that we wouldn't be able to do it\nagain so soon.

At that time, we were caught in the downdraft,
then forcibly pulling up the aircraft meant it
sustained huge G forces, damaging parts of the
glider.
It's possible to fix it, but at the very least,\nthere was no hope that we'd be able to fly today.
Amane's objective was to fly to the Morning\nGlory.
Now that goal had been achieved, there was\nnothing left to do.
'You haven't seen any of the others, have you?'
'Why not?'
'Because this year's summer holiday was so fun.\nIt's hard for me... to leave this place.'
'I'm sorry but could you say something to them\nfor me? I'm not much of a talker...'
Amane speaks with a really troubled look on her\nface, and continued to pack all of the things she\nhad organized into a large travel bag.
She's been living here a long time, so she has a\nlot of personal items.
'I'll help you carry it.'
'No, it's OK. It's mostly things that I don't\nneed anyway, so I'll just leave behind anything I\ncan't carry.'
Amane speaks while gazing at her desk, which is\nstill cluttered.
As she looks it over, her gaze stops at the photo\nframe.
'Are you leaving his behind too?'
'Yeah.'
'She smiles as if to say 'Even if I took it with\nme, I wouldn't know what to do with it'.
Seeing her sad smile made all the feelings of\nregret that I'd bottled up come pouring out.
'I'm... gonna continue it.'
'I'll improve, and I will definitely fly to the\nMorning Glory in the glider that you and the\nothers have made!'
'...Sure.'
Amane nods, and after thinking a moment, puts\ndown her bag and stands in front of me.
She takes my hand and holds it gently.
In the garage, which doesn't have air\nconditioning, it's as hot as a sauna.
My hands are covered in sweat but hers are as\nsmooth and as soft as freshly washed sheets.
Then Amane, with eyes like a little kid's... but\na little more grown-up than yesterday, looks me\nin the eyes.
'...Thank you, Aoi.'
'Thanks to you guys, in the end... I was able to\ngo to that place.'
'To the sky that until now, I'd only been able to\nlook at from below.'
As Amane speaks, she has a small, yet fulfilled\nsmile.
'How about Isuka's feelings...?'
I wanted to ask her if she understood the reason\nwhy Isuka had become so obsessed with gliders.
'To be honest, I still don't really know. But,\nit's been decided.'
'So, thank you.'
Amane shuts her eyes and hugs me gently.
To tell the truth...
...I thought I was gonna cry.
'Use the things in here however you want, The\nwinch at the runway is equipment that belongs to\nthe Soaring Club.'
'...What about these designs?'
The designs had been left on the drawing board.
'I finished them last night but I don't need them\nanymore.'
'I'm sorry but if you don't need them, just throw\nthem away.'
'I couldn't do that...'
'Well then, if I don't get going, I'll miss my\nbus.'
